719572f-a.title: Manhattan: East River Drive - Gracie Square
719572f-a.text:
East River Drive, at Gracie Square (East 84th Street) showing constructional details depicted by a series of oils by Mrs.
John Markell. These were on display at the Municipal Reference Library from April 15th to the 30th of 1940. Titles of same are: From Beekman Place, Smoke, and Sunrise. The arched span in the background is the Hellgate Bridge. Preceding same is the horizontal Triboro Bridge. To the right is Astoria in the Borough of Queens.
1939
Views 1, 2, 3
Nathan Schwartz photo
New York Public Library
719572f-a.folder: East River Drive & Gracie Square, Manhattan, NY

719573f-b.title: Manhattan: East River Drive - Gracie Square
719573f-b.text:
East River Drive, at Gracie Square (East 84th Street) showing constructional details depicted by a series of oils by Mrs. John Markell. These were on display at the Municipal Reference Library from April 15th to the 30th of 1940. Titles of same are: Powder monkey, Dynamiting and drilling in the rock, and The blast. These titles are self-explanatory and indicate the preparatory work necessitated. Being in a southeastward direction, one sees Welfare Island and the
Queensboro Bridge in the background.
1939
Views 1, 2, 3
Nathan Schwartz, photo
New York Public Library

719575f-a.title: Manhattan: East River Drive - Gracie Square
719575f-a.text:
East River Drive, at Gracie Square (East 84th Street) showing constructional details depicted by a series of oils by Mrs. John Markell. These were on display at the Municipal Reference Library from April 15th to the 30th of 1940. Titles of same are: Rainy day, Beginning of the work, Ice in the River. The first two views are southward towards the Queensboro Bridge and Welfare Island. No. 3 is in a northeastward direction from Beekman Place. This is a point south of the Bridge.
1939

719576f-b.title: Manhattan: East River Drive - Gracie Square
719576f-b.text:
Fast River Drive, at Gracie Square (East 84th Street) showing constructional details depicted by a series of oils by Mrs. John Markell. These were on display at the Municipal Reference Library from April 15th to the 30th of 1940. Titles of same are: Drivers, Hoisting cement blocks, The little green tug and "Buggies." This formed the first stage, the seawall. Constructed by the Federal Government, it enclosed a fill upon which was erected the double decker roadway skirting Carl Schurz Park. In the background is Welfare Island and the Queensboro Bridge.
1939
Views 1, 2, 3, 4
Nathan Schwartz, photo
New York Public Library

719578f-b.title: Manhattan: East River Drive - Gracie Square
719578f-b.text:
East River Drive, at Gracie Suuare (East 84th Street) showing constructional details depicted by a series of oils by Mrs. John Markell. These were on display at the Municipal Reference Library from April 15th to the 30th of 1940. Titles of same are: Twinkling Lights, City fireboat, gas tanks, and A storm coming. This series is southeastward across the East River, showing in the background Welfare Island and the Queensboro Bridge.
1939

719579f-b.title: Manhattan: East River Drive - Gracie Square
719579f-b.text:
East River Drive, at Gracie Square (East 84th Street) showing constructional details depicted by a series of oils by Mrs. John Markell. These were on display at the Municipal Reference Library from April 15th to the 30th of 1940. Titles of same are: Concrete mixture on East River Drive, Concrete mixer in a snowstorm, The bosses and "Elephant Tusk." All four of this series are in an upstream direction and show the Tribroro and the Hellgate Bridges in their backgrounds. The light house appearing on the right is at the northern extremity of Welfare Island. This elongated hospital center divides the East River, separating Manhattan from the Borough
of Queens.
1939
Views 1, 2, 3, 4
Nathan Schwartz, photo
New York Public Library

719582f-b.title: Manhattan: East River Drive - Gracie Square
719582f-b.text:
East River Drive, at Gracie Square
(East 84th Street) showing constructional details depicted by a series of oils by Mrs. John Markell. These were on display at the Municipal Reference Library from April 15th to the 30th of 1940. Titles of same are: A derrick, Driver with water pump, Flood tide, and Rough Weather. Three of these are southeastward and have the Queensboro Bridge in their background. The least enumerated is upstream towards the Triboro and the Hellgate Bridges.
1939
Views 1-4
Nathan Schwartz, photo
New York Public Library
